title: Writing & Selling Romantic Comedy Screenplays
description:
Writing & Selling Romantic Comedy Screenplays (Writing & Selling Screenplays) 
by Craig Batty(Author), Helen Jacey(Author)

The many ways that "happy after ever" can come aboutâ€”case studies and analyses include Due Date, I Give it a Year, Midnight in Paris, Ted, and Tamara Drewe

Contemporary film audiences want and need sophisticated, authentic films that show how we now live and loveâ€”so what does this mean for the screenwriter developing a romcom? And how does one write heart-warming stories for a genre that is constantly evolving, from bromcom to zomcom to famcom? This guide offers a fresh approach to creating narratives for this ever-changing genre. Moving away from rigid and limited definitions that have evolved out of mainstream genre films, the book embraces a working definition that crosses cultural and national boundaries to give screenwriters a truly international perspective on writing comedic love stories.
